Description: Uniformed bust of Lord Nelson three-quarter left. (obverse)
River god Nilus reclining left, viewing the action in the bay. (reverse)
Curator's comments: Brown 1980 states: A copy of this medal struck in Berlin metal was produced in 1814 by L. Posch. See also Brown 1p106.447. Bibliography: Milford Haven, Admiral the Marquis of. 'British Naval Medals', London, 1919, 475; Sandwich, The Rt. Hon. the Earl of. 'British and Foreign medals relating to naval and maritime affairs', 2nd ed., London, 1950, N/1.
Bibliographic references: Brown 1980 / A catalogue of British historical medals 1760-1960, vol.I: the accession of George III to the death of William IV (p109.448)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Horatio Nelson, 1st Baron and Viscount Nelson
Associated events: Commemoration of: Battle of the Nile, 1798
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs P C Ashe
